intro: Draba nitida, commonly known as the glabrous whitlow grass, is a small flowering plant belonging to the Brassicaceae family. It is native to Europe and parts of Asia, typically found in rocky or alpine environments. The plant has basal leaves that are linear and covered in fine hairs, while its flowering stems are usually unbranched. It produces small, white or pale yellow flowers arranged in racemes, which bloom in early spring. Draba nitida is known for its ability to thrive in harsh, nutrient-poor soils, making it a resilient member of its ecosystem.
